We are using XAML in WPF, using a display of a "map" as a thumbnail. 

 

 

<font size="2" color="#a31515"><font size="2" color="#a31515">

<ListBox Name="DataThumbnailList" SelectionChanged="DataThumbnailList_SelectionChanged">  </ListBox>

 

The image is created using D3ColorMap,

 

As you can see we have set "SelectionChanged" to "DataThumbnailList_SelectionChanged", the problem is that the image we are using is the D3ColorMap and not a static image so "clicking" on this "image" doesn't fire the SelectionChanged Event, only on the border area.  I'm sure we could just use a static image in place of this, but we like the way this image truly represents what we are displaying on our main view.  SO, is there a way to bubble up the selectionchanged event in the WPF so we can support this?
